item.title: Initial setup
item.description: Setup Dependencies To set up a WirtBot you must first make sure that your machine has the following dependencies installed: Linux Kernel > 5.6 or the WireGuardÂ® Kernel Module Docker docker-compose Initial setup Here is an example docker-compose.yml for a WirtBot with DNS: version: "3.4" services: WirtBot: image: bmff/wirtbot:latest container_name: WirtBot ports: - 53:53 - 80:80 - 3030:3030 - 10101:10101/udp restart: "unless-stopped" cap_add: - NET_ADMIN sysctls: - net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6=0 environment: - "ALLOWED_ORIGIN=http://IP/HOSTNAME_OF_THE_WIRTBOT_HOST_MACHINE" volumes: - wireguard-data:/etc/wireguard - coredns-data:/etc/coredns volumes: wireguard-data: coredns-data: Copy this configuration into a file on the machine, update the “ALLOWED_ORIGIN” variable and run docker-compose up -d.
